headline: Facebook will ban ads that seek to delegitimize US election
summary: Facebook on Wednesday announced that it will not allow any ads on its service that seek to delegitimize the outcome of an election, including the upcoming U.S. election on Nov. 3.

headline: The Trump-Biden debate helped the stock market go higher, Jim Cramer says
summary: "Wall Street was worried about a lot of things going into last night's debate and almost none of them came true," the "Mad Money" host said.

headline: Stock futures flat as investors brace for final quarter of 2020
summary: The first trading day of the fourth and final quarter of 2020 occurs on Thursday.
"The key with our portfolio of brands is they're going to be very differentiated," Molson Coors CEO Gavin Hattersley said on CNBC.
headline: Hard seltzer market is big enough for multiple brands, says Molson Coors CEO

summary: Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong told staff in an email that the company would offer four-to-six-month severance packages for anyone "who doesn't feel comfortable with this new direction."
headline: Coinbase CEO discourages politics at work, offers generous severance to employees who want to quit

summary: Daly likened the rescue funding so far to a bridge that has helped growth recover somewhat but still needs to be extended.
headline: Fed's Daly calls for more fiscal help to get the economy out of a 'big ditch'
After September slump, trader plays AMD stock for fourth-quarter rally
summary: Advanced Micro Devices is on track to close out September lower. Longtime AMD bull Todd Gordon of TradingAnalysis.com sees strong demand and solid technicals as laying the groundwork for a breakout in the fourth quarter.

headline: Apollo co-founder Josh Harris says the SPAC trend is 'here to stay'

summary: Social Capital Founder and Chief Executive Officer Chamath Palihapitiya said the stock market will continue to move higher regardless of a Trump or Biden presidency.
headline: Palihapitiya says election won't matter, stocks going higher next 4 years: 'You need to be long'

summary: "Obviously, we're doing extraordinary actions, not just the Fed funds rate ... but we need to because it's a crisis," Dallas Fed President Robert Kaplan told CNBC.
headline: Near-zero interest rates may be needed for up to 3 years, says Dallas Fed's Robert Kaplan

summary: Chad Dorrill, who died of complications from Covid-19, was attending classes online and living off-campus, Appalachian State University officials said.
headline: Appalachian State tells students to 'remain vigilant' after student dies from coronavirus complications

summary: Harris added that investors no longer have an excuse for being unable to find investments that prioritize a diversity.
headline: Morgan Stanley's Harris says Black Lives Matter has helped sparked interest in diverse companies
Citigroup’s new stock-trading chief is cutting jobs in effort to revive the flagging business
summary: The moves are just the first steps that Fater Belbachir, who joined Citigroup from Barclays last month to jump-start the firm's equities business, is expected to take.

headline: 1 in 4 women are considering downshifting their careers or leaving the workforce due to the coronavirus
summary: New report from Lean In and McKinsey & Company shows that women are being disproportionately impacted by Covid-19 and many are thinking about leaving the workforce.
The options market is feeling bullish on gold as we get closer to November's presidential election.
headline: Options trader makes a huge bet on bullion
Barry Sternlicht sees a 'significant correction in high flying stocks' with a Democratic Sweep
summary: Starwood's Barry Sternlicht said the stock market would suffer from a Democratic sweep.
The NFL said the Tennessee Titans-Pittsburgh Steelers game would is postponed after eight new Covid-19 cases.
headline: NFL postpones Titans-Steelers Week 4 game after positive Covid-19 tests
Vista's Robert Smith says there are more opportunities in private markets than public right now
summary: "There's actually a large number of software companies that are actually getting to a state of maturity," Smith said.

headline: Nets owner Joseph Tsai sees next season as 'tricky' but expects a 'very nice rebound'
